info.description: Manages User Access via Functional Roles and Access Roles in Aladdin Data Cloud (ADC). Used by Studio's ADC Admin Center.
info.title: Adc Access

get.description: Return user defaults in ADC. Individual users can see their own properties.

post.description:
Sets a default functional role on an user
Caller of the API will be validated to determine if user is in ADC.
(-- api-linter: core::0136::http-uri-suffix=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to keep the method name as singular because this is activating only one functional role --)

post.description:
Creates a custom functional role in Snowflake. 
User access to functional roles is managed through 
Aladdin Permissions. A custom functional role can be used 
to apply role based access to data sets. Upon successful 
API call, the functional role, and a corresponding access 
role with naming convention <functional_role_name>_access_role, 
are created. Select privileges on a view (data set) in a custom 
database such as CLIENTDATADB should be granted by an administrator 
to the access role, not functional role. Please note: before a 
functional role can be used in Snowflake, an entry must be 
added to the "STUDIO_QUERY" decode in Aladdin. The cde 
value of the decode entry must match the name of the 
functional role in Snowflake, excluding the "_ROLE" suffix. 
For example, if the name of the role created via the 
Functional Role API is "CUSTOM_ROLE" the entry in the 
STUDIO_QUERY decode table would look like: 
(cde=CUSTOM; decde="role description"; cde_order=<next available number>).

parameters.description: Functional role
parameters.name: body

delete.description:
Deletes a custom functional role from Snowflake. Upon successful 
API call, the functional role, and its corresponding access 
role will be deleted.

post.description:
Enables user to grant an existing warehouse to a functional role in Snowflake platform
This action is allowed only for client billable warehouses.
It does not permit users to modify grants for a restricted-billable or non-billable warehouses
The use of this operation requires "StudioAdmin" Aladdin perm assigned to the user.
post.summary: Grant virtual warehouse access to Functional Role

post.description:
Enables user to revoke an existing warehouse from a functional role in Snowflake platform
This action is allowed only for client billable warehouses.
It does not permit users to modify grants for a restricted-billable or non-billable warehouses
The use of this operation requires "StudioAdmin" Aladdin perm assigned to the user.
post.summary: Revoke virtual warehouse access from Functional Role

post.description:
Grants permissions to a dataset by restricting access to general role and granting the datasets access only to the specified functional role in input.
Caller of the API will be used to determine if user is authorized to grant the roles.
Returns the AdcDatasetQualifiedName corresponding to the dataset which permissions were granted for

post.description:
Revoke access to a dataset from a functional role and thus making it accessible to all under general role.
Caller of the API will be used to determine if user is authorized to revoke the roles.
Returns the AdcDatasetQualifiedName corresponding to the dataset which permissions were revoked for

get.description:
Lists the datasets permissioned by Client Admins and are with restricted access to certain functional roles only.
Caller of the API will be used to determine if user is authorized to view the data.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'ListPermissionedDatasets' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'ListPermissionedDatasets' must match the call that provided the page
token.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
The maximum number of AccessRoles to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most X
AccessRoles will be returned. The maximum value is Y; values
above Y will be coerced to Y.
parameters.name: pageSize

400.description: Aladdin速 will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

code.description: A short mnemonic reference code for the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

post.description:
Applies row access policy on an ADC table by the column the dataset is entitled on.
Returns the applied row access policy name corresponding to the dataset on which the policies were applied.
post.summary: Apply row access policy on a dataset

parameters.description: column name from the on which the entitlements are applied
parameters.name: body

post.description:
Revokes row access policy on an ADC table by the column the dataset is entitled on.
Returns the revoked row access policy name corresponding to the dataset on which the policies were applied.
post.summary: Revoke row access policy on a dataset

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

v1AdcDatasetQualifiedName.title:
Composite key of database, schema, and dataset name providing a fully-
qualified schema object 
(see https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/name-resolution.html)

database.title: database name where the view is located

schema.title:
schema name where the view is located
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

v1AdcUser.description:
An ADC User resource is the current representation of a User in Aladdin Data Cloud.
The resource describes a user's metadata and configuration details.

id.title: this maps to the 'NAME' property for "DESC USER" on SF

v1FilterFunctionalRolesRequest.title:
The request message for AdcAccessAPI.FilterFunctionalRoles.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::request-message-name=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the request name does follow the pattern Filter<PluralResource>Request --)

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterFunctionalRoles' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterFunctionalRoles' must match the call that provided the page
token.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of FunctionalRoles to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most X
FunctionalRoles will be returned. The maximum value is Y; values
above Y will be coerced to Y.

v1FilterFunctionalRolesResponse.title:
The response message for AdcAccessAPI.FilterFunctionalRoles.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::response-message-name=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the response name does follow the pattern Filter<PluralResource>Response --)

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1FunctionalRole.title: FunctionalRole describes function role in Aladdin Data Cloud

v1FunctionalRoleQuery.title: Parameterization for a query for a collection of functional roles

mode.title: Mode enum indicating which type of object to get functional roles for

adcDatasetQualifiedName.title: Optional AdcDatasetQualifiedName to pass if getting functional roles for dataset

Qualified name for the ADC dataset for which to get functional roles
granting access to the dataset

virtualWarehouseName.description: virtual warehouse name to grant access to.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1Mode.description:
- MODE_UNSPECIFIED: No mode specified
 - MODE_ADC_USER: ADC user mode -- get functional roles for current user
 - MODE_CLIENT_ADMIN: Client admin mode -- get functional roles for client admin
 - MODE_DATASET: Dataset mode -- get functional roles for dataset
v1Mode.title: Enum to indicate which type of object functional roles are being retrieved for

adcDatasetQualifiedName.title:
Qualified name for the ADC dataset for which to get functional roles
revoking access to the dataset

virtualWarehouseName.title: virtual warehouse name to revoke access from

v1RowAccessPolicy.title: RowAccessPolicy describes the applied or revoked policy on the dataset

entitledOn.title: name of the row access policy

adcDatasetQualifiedName.title: Qualified name for the ADC Actual table to add/revoke entitlements from

policyName.title: Optional name of the policy applied in the database

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.platform.studio.adc.adc_access.v1.AdcAcc: This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.studio.adc.adc_access.v1.AdcAccess API

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.platform.studio.adc.adc_access.v1.AdcAcc: This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.studio.adc.adc_access.v1.AdcAccess API
